decoder

Class AbstractNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoder.AbstractNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreeNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GroupNode, LeafNode

    public abstract class AbstractNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements TreeNode
    This represents the abstract methods of a node tree that will code and decode prefix trees. Every node has a coding character, and leaves contain the coding character and a decoded symbol. The parents contains arrays pointing to the children nodes.

      Constructors

      The constructor for a node.

    • Method Detail

      • getCodeName

        public java.lang.Character getCodeName()
        Gets the coding character for a specific node.
        Specified by:
        getCodeName in interface TreeNode

      • getCodeNameAndSymbol

        public java.lang.String getCodeNameAndSymbol()
        Gets the full code for a symbol by combining all of the coding characters along the way to reach the leaf. For non-leaf nodes, this returns null.
        Specified by:
        getCodeNameAndSymbol in interface TreeNode
        Returns:
        Returns the full code path and the symbol, which is null for non-leaf nodes.

      • getSymbol

        public java.lang.Character getSymbol()
        This returns the symbol of the node. For non-leaf nodes this is null.
        Specified by:
        getSymbol in interface TreeNode
        Returns:
        Returns the symbol as a character.

      • checkNode

        public TreeNode checkNode(char check)
        Check the children nodes for a specific character. For non-parent nodes, this returns null.
        Specified by:
        checkNode in interface TreeNode
        Parameters:
        check - The character to check for.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the child exists, or null otherwise.

      • checkNumberofNodes

        public boolean checkNumberofNodes(int compare)
        Checks the number of nodes for the parent. Returns true if it equals the input parameter, or false if it does not. For leaf nodes it will always return true.
        Specified by:
        checkNumberofNodes in interface TreeNode
        Parameters:
        compare - The number to compare to, this is the number of distinct characters in the code list.
        Returns:
        Returns true is the number of nodes for parent nodes matches the integer input. For children it will return true.
